talkingPoints.statement: FCS provides ongoing payments for housing and rent costs.
talkingPoints.explanation: FCS specifically does NOT provide ongoing payments for housing, rent, or room and board costs. It provides support services to help obtain and maintain stable housing.

talkingPoints.statement: FCS provides wages or wage enhancements for clients.
talkingPoints.explanation: FCS does NOT provide wages or wage enhancements for clients. The supported employment benefit helps people obtain and keep jobs but does not cover or supplement wages.

talkingPoints.statement: FCS is an entitlement program that all Medicaid recipients can access.
talkingPoints.explanation: FCS is NOT an entitlement. It is a targeted Medicaid benefit for eligible clients with complex health needs who meet specific criteria.

talkingPoints.statement: Supportive housing services include landlord relations and crisis management.
talkingPoints.explanation: These are two of the key services listed under supportive housing services, along with housing assessments, identifying resources, and independent living skills development.

talkingPoints.statement: To be eligible for FCS services, individuals must be Medicaid-eligible and complete a needs assessment.
talkingPoints.explanation: Both Medicaid eligibility and a completed needs assessment are required for FCS services, in addition to meeting specific population criteria.

talkingPoints.statement: The minimum age for supported employment services is 18 years old.
talkingPoints.explanation: Vulnerable youth age 16 and older with a behavioral health condition are eligible for supported employment services.
talkingPoints.sourceSection: Who is eligible for supported employment

talkingPoints.statement: Wellpoint serves as the single statewide third-party administrator (TPA) for FCS.
talkingPoints.explanation: Wellpoint is contracted by HCA as the single statewide TPA managing both supportive housing and supported employment services under FCS.

talkingPoints.statement: FCS providers are reimbursed on a fee-for-service basis.
talkingPoints.explanation: Providers of FCS services contract with the TPA (Wellpoint) and are reimbursed on a fee-for-service basis.

talkingPoints.statement: The supportive housing benefit will replace existing services currently available to eligible populations.
talkingPoints.explanation: The supportive housing benefit will NOT supplant existing services currently available to eligible populations. It is designed to complement existing services.

talkingPoints.statement: Individuals experiencing chronic homelessness as defined by HUD are eligible for supportive housing services.
talkingPoints.explanation: Chronic homelessness as defined by the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development is one of the key eligibility criteria for supportive housing services.
talkingPoints.sourceSection: Who is eligible for supportive housing

talkingPoints.statement: Supported employment services include job coaching and skills-building for negotiating with employers.
talkingPoints.explanation: Both job coaching and skills-building for negotiating with prospective employers are listed as components of supported employment services.

talkingPoints.statement: Only individuals enrolled in the ABD program are eligible for supported employment services.
talkingPoints.explanation: Multiple populations are eligible including ABD enrollees, HEN enrollees, those with mental illness/SUD, LTSS recipients, and vulnerable youth 16+.
talkingPoints.sourceSection: Who is eligible for supported employment

talkingPoints.statement: FCS is part of Washington's five-year Medicaid transformation demonstration.
talkingPoints.explanation: FCS is Medicaid Transformation Initiative 3, part of the five-year demonstration agreement between Washington State HCA and CMS.

talkingPoints.statement: Housing assessments and identifying housing resources are part of supportive housing services.
talkingPoints.explanation: Both housing assessments and identifying housing resources are specifically listed as components of supportive housing services.

talkingPoints.statement: FCS creates two new targeted benefits: supportive housing and supported employment.
talkingPoints.explanation: FCS creates exactly two new targeted benefits that help vulnerable beneficiaries obtain and maintain stable housing and employment.

talkingPoints.statement: Vocational/job-related discovery or assessment is included in supported employment services.
talkingPoints.explanation: Vocational/job-related discovery or assessment is specifically listed as a component of supported employment services.

talkingPoints.statement: The FCS contact number for members with questions is 844-451-2828.
talkingPoints.explanation: Wellpoint members can contact FCS with questions about the program at 844-451-2828.

talkingPoints.statement: Individuals must have a severe and persistent mental illness to be eligible for any FCS services.
talkingPoints.explanation: While mental illness is one eligibility pathway, there are multiple eligibility criteria including chronic homelessness, institutional care dependence, and other complex needs.

talkingPoints.statement: Independent living skills development is a component of supportive housing services.
talkingPoints.explanation: Independent living skills development is specifically listed as one of the services provided under supportive housing.

talkingPoints.statement: FCS services are available to all Washington residents regardless of insurance status.
talkingPoints.explanation: Individuals must be Medicaid-eligible to receive FCS services. This is a fundamental requirement along with completing a needs assessment.

talkingPoints.statement: Support obtaining a lease is included in supportive housing services.
talkingPoints.explanation: Support obtaining a lease is one of the specific services listed under supportive housing services.

talkingPoints.statement: FCS helps eligible clients with complex health needs obtain and maintain housing and employment stability.
talkingPoints.explanation: This is the core definition of FCS - targeted Medicaid benefits for clients with complex health needs to achieve housing and employment stability.

talkingPoints.statement: Planning for employment is a component of supported employment services.
talkingPoints.explanation: Planning for employment is specifically listed as one of the components of supported employment services.

talkingPoints.statement: Individuals enrolled in the Housing and Essential Needs (HEN) program are eligible for supported employment services.
talkingPoints.explanation: HEN program enrollees are specifically listed as one of the populations eligible for supported employment services.
talkingPoints.sourceSection: Who is eligible for supported employment

talkingPoints.statement: FCS services must be the result of a referral from a needs assessment.
talkingPoints.explanation: Both supportive housing and supported employment services require referral as the result of a needs assessment.
